cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles W of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the eastern Gulf, slowing and turning north toward the north-central Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana/Mississippi coast).
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana or the Mississippi Gulf Coast (near the Mouth of the Mississippi River to Gulfport area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Grand Isle, LA to the Alabama/Florida border, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas (metro New Orleans).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to the Alabama/Florida border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, Lake Borgne and Mobile Bay.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through coastal Mississippi and Alabama.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (59% chance of ≥34 kt) with a 27% chance of ≥50 kt; hurricane-force winds are possible if strengthening occurs.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 6–9 ft surge from the Mouth of the Mississippi River eastward with 2–4 ft in Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas, threatening low-lying terminals and levee tops.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches with isolated 18 inches possible, producing flash and urban flooding around New Orleans and along the lower Mississippi River.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and isolated tornadoes ahead of landfall.
